bestBHT.bht: May the God of hope, the God of peace, the God of patience and comfort, grant you to be of the same mind according to Christ Jesus. Just as Jesus desired to follow the will of the Father, so too should believers strive to be in harmony with one another, imitating His example. It is through the power of Christ Jesus that this unity can be achieved, for God alone is the author of patience and consolation, conveying them to our hearts through His Spirit and Word.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: Such beautiful names of God are taken from the graces which He inspires: as 'the God of hope' (Romans 15:13), 'the God of peace' (Romans 16:20).
It is not mere unanimity which the apostle seeks for them; for unanimity in evil is to be deprecated.
But it is 'according to Christ Jesus'—after the sublimest model of Him whose all-absorbing desire was to do, 'not His own will, but the will of Him that sent Him' (John 6:38).
Albert Barnes: The example of God here, who bears long with his children, and is not angry soon at their offences, is a strong argument why Christians should bear with each other.
If God bears long and patiently with 'our' infirmities, 'we' ought to bear with each other.
If all Christians would imitate the example of Christ, and follow his instructions, there would be no contentions among them.
John Calvin: God alone is doubtless the author of patience and of consolation; for he conveys both to our hearts by his Spirit: yet he employs his word as the instrument.
Miserable indeed is the union which is unconnected with God, and that is unconnected with him, which alienates us from his truth.

There is then no reason for any to boast that he will give glory to God after his own manner; for the unity of his servants is so much esteemed by God, that he will not have his glory sounded forth amidst discords and contentions.
Philip Schaff: He well knows that the Scripture itself is inefficacious without help of the God of the Scriptures.
To be of the same mind points to harmony of feeling in their intercourse rather than to unanimity of opinion on the disputed points of practice.
According to His example, but also according to His will as Head of the Church and according to His Spirit as the Life of the Church.
Archibald T. Robertson: The God of patience and comfort.
John Gill: The object addressed is described as 'the God of patience', because he is the author and giver of that grace: it is a fruit of his Spirit, produced by the means of his word, called the word of his patience.

God is the great pattern and exemplar of patience; he is patient himself, and bears much and long with the children of men; with wicked men, whose patient forbearance and longsuffering being despised by them, will be an aggravation of their damnation; but his longsuffering towards his elect issues in their salvation.

It is God alone that can give and continue such a Spirit: this the apostle knew, and therefore prays that he would 'grant' it: and for which request there is a foundation for faith and hope concerning it; since God has promised he will give his people one heart, and one way, as to fear him, so to love one another.
John Wesley: According to the power of Christ Jesus.

bhtAttempts.bht: May the God of hope, the God of peace, the God of patience and comfort, grant you to be of the same mind according to Christ Jesus. For it is not mere unanimity that the apostle seeks, but a unity that is founded in the graces inspired by God. Just as Jesus desired to follow the will of the Father, so too should believers strive to be in harmony with one another, imitating His example and following His instructions. It is through the power of Christ Jesus that this unity can be achieved, for God alone is the author of patience and consolation, conveying them to our hearts through His Spirit and His Word. Let us therefore seek to be united in love, for such unity is highly esteemed by God.

Let us seek to be united in love, for such unity is greatly valued by God.
